holdings.author: Aaron Reed
holdings.title: Response Assistant
holdings.summary: Adds some helpful testing commands for changing default responses.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Assorted Text Generation
holdings.summary: Provides a range of convenient say phrases, including more varieties of number-printing, descriptions of object locations, and descriptions of which members of a set conform to a criterion (such as "Three of them are closed." when speaking of a group of doors).

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Complex Listing
holdings.summary: Complex Listing provides more sophisticated listing options: the ability to impose special ordering instructions on a list, and also the ability to change the delimiters of the list to produce different styles and effects.

holdings.author: Eric Eve
holdings.title: List Control
holdings.summary: Provides a means of using tables as shuffled, cyclic or stop lists.

holdings.author: Eric Eve
holdings.title: List Controller
holdings.summary: Provides a means of using tables as shuffled, cyclic or stopping lists. This is an alternative to List Control that uses list controller objects instead of a Table of Table Types.

holdings.author: Eric Eve
holdings.title: Text Capture
holdings.summary: Allows the capture of text that would otherwise be output to the screen, so that the text can be further manipulated, displayed at some other point, or simply discarded. Version 6 avoids using phrases deprecated in 6E59.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Punctuation Removal
holdings.summary: Offers specialized commands to strip troublesome punctuation such as periods, commas, question marks, and quote marks out of the player's typed commands; provides a converter to especially interpret titles that contain full stops, such as "Mrs." or "Dr.".

holdings.author: Ron Newcomb
holdings.title: Phrases for Tables with Topics
holdings.summary: Grants five new phrases regarding the player's command, the matched text, and the topic understood: if one is a topic listed in a table, if one includes or matches a topic listed in a table, what corresponds to one within a table, and the last phrase corrects a bug so the topic understood may be used within an understand-as-mistake line.

holdings.author: Aaron Reed
holdings.title: Dynamic Rooms
holdings.summary: Create and destroy new rooms on the fly. While this is technically possible with Jesse McGrew's Dynamic Objects, the method here is simpler, customized for rooms, and available for both z-code and Glulx.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Facing
holdings.summary: Provides actions to face a direction, look toward a named room, or look through a named door.

holdings.author: Andrew Plotkin
holdings.title: Disappearing Doors
holdings.summary: The ability to remove doors from the world and put them back.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Deluxe Doors
holdings.summary: Allows for doors that are implemented as having independent 'faces' -- to put a knocker on that can only be seen from on side, for instance, or to allow the player to lock one side with a key but the other with a latch. Also introduces a 'latched door' kind.

holdings.author: Gavin Lambert
holdings.title: Secret Doors
holdings.summary: Doors and switches that cannot be acted upon until they are discovered.

holdings.author: Hanon Ondricek
holdings.title: Easy Doors
holdings.summary: Easy Doors provides a new kind of door which does not use map connections, and may be manipulated via rules more flexibly than the standard doors provided in Inform 7.

holdings.author: Eric Eve
holdings.title: Variable Time Control
holdings.summary: Allows individual actions to take a different number of seconds, or no time at all. Also allows the standard time taken per turn to be defined as so many seconds, which can be varied during the course of play.

holdings.author: Ron Newcomb
holdings.title: Unsuccessful PC Attempt
holdings.summary: Will run the Unsuccessful Attempt By rules for all characters, including the player.  Also silences the library messages printed by the built-in Check rules.

holdings.author: Eric Eve
holdings.title: Epistemology
holdings.summary: Keeping track of what the player character knows and sees.

holdings.author: Alice Grove
holdings.title: Simple Spelling
holdings.summary: Simple Spelling aims to make stories more screen-reader-friendly by allowing players to request the spelling of any visible thing. This extension adds two actions: 'listing visible items for spelling' and 'spelling the numbered word.'

holdings.author: Gavin Lambert
holdings.title: Exit Lister
holdings.summary: Based on Exit Lister by Andre Kosmos, Gavin Lambert's edition reworks the internal design and provides more options for controlling lists in dark rooms.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Introductions
holdings.summary: Introductions provides an introductory paragraph about objects in a room description the first time the player looks in that location. It also allows the author to add segue text that will appear between one description and the next.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Ordinary Room Description
holdings.summary: Note: An extension to go with Room Description Control, which emulates as closely as possible the behavior of Inform defaults, but allows the intervention of Room Description Control.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Room Description Control
holdings.summary: A framework by which the author can considerably change the listing of objects in a room description. Includes facilities for concealing objects arbitrarily and changing the order in which objects are listed.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Single Paragraph Description
holdings.summary: A room description extension based on Room Description Control (which is required). All contents of a room are summarized in a single paragraph, starting with the regular room description.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Tailored Room Description
holdings.summary: An extension to go with Room Description Control, providing a different style of room description than the default. Parenthetical remarks such as (open) and (in which are...) are omitted in favor of full English sentences. Removes the requirement for Text Variations.

holdings.author: Eric Eve
holdings.title: Underside
holdings.summary: Allows objects to be put under other objects. An underside usually starts out closed so that its contents are hidden from view. Requires Version 7 (or later) of Bulk Limiter; the space under objects is limited by bulk. Underside is compatible with Version 10 or later of Implicit Actions, but does not require it. Version 5 of Underside avoids features deprecated in Version 6E59 of Inform.

holdings.author: Eric Eve
holdings.title: Hiding Under
holdings.summary: Allows things to be hidden under other things, using a many-to-one underconcealment relation. Can be used either standalone (with basic functionality) or in conjunction with Underside (to add fuller functionality to both extensions). Version 3 of Hiding Under avoids using phrases deprecated in Version 6E59 of Inform.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Approaches
holdings.summary: Approaches provides a GO TO place action which allows the player to move through visited rooms to a new location. It also allows other characters to traverse the map to named locations. It is designed to work with Locksmith by Emily Short.

holdings.author: Ron Newcomb
holdings.title: Permission to Visit
holdings.summary: In lieu of compass directions, we may VISIT, ATTEND, GO TO, and FIND various people, events, places, and things.  Characters may INVITE, PERMIT, and FORBID each other to or from their respective domains.

holdings.author: Juhana Leinonen
holdings.title: Regional Travel
holdings.summary: Allows the player to travel between regions. Useful for example when the player travels between large regions far apart from each other (e.g. cities), or for traveling in vehicles and public transportation.

subsections.title: Entering and Exiting, Sitting and Standing

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Modified Exit
holdings.summary: Changes the handling of the EXIT action, allowing commands such as EXIT PLATFORM and GET OUT OF CHAIR, making characters leave enterable objects before traveling, and altering the default interpretation of >OUT when the player is neither inside an object nor in a room with an outside exit. Updated for adaptive text.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Locksmith
holdings.summary: Implicit handling of doors and containers so that lock manipulation is automatic if the player has the necessary keys.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Skeleton Keys
holdings.summary: Allows for locks which can be opened by more than one key.

holdings.author: Aaron Reed
holdings.title: Extended Grammar
holdings.summary: Some of the most commonly attempted synonyms for verb words. Based on the Inform 6 extension ExpertGrammar.h by Emily Short.

holdings.author: Ron Newcomb
holdings.title: Editable Stored Actions
holdings.summary: This extension expands section 12.20 of Writing with Inform.  The individual parts of a stored action -- actor, noun, second noun, action-name -- can now be directly changed.  Also adds four new parts: request, text, participle, and preposition.

holdings.author: Eric Eve
holdings.title: Implicit Actions
holdings.summary: Provides implicit taking, opening, closing, locking and unlocking actions for a variety of cases where this makes for smoother game play. The extension also defines phrases which make it easy to define additional implicit actions if desired. Version 11 can be used with Locksmith by Emily Short (although Implicit Actions covers most of what Locksmith does, and in most cases it will be better to use Implicit Actions without Locksmith). Requires Plurality by Emily Short and Version 5 of Text Capture by Eric Eve.

holdings.author: Eric Eve
holdings.title: Limited Implicit Actions
holdings.summary: A cut-down version of Implicit Actions for use where code size may be restricted and the full functionality of Implicit Actions is not needed. Requires Plurality by Emily Short and is compatible with Locksmith by Emily Short.

holdings.author: Aaron Reed
holdings.title: Small Kindnesses
holdings.summary: Provides a number of small interface improvements for players, understanding commands like GO BACK and GET IN, automatically getting off enclosables before moving, responding to vague movement commands when there is only one sensible option, and more.

holdings.author: Ron Newcomb
holdings.title: After Not Doing Something
holdings.summary: A small, straightforward extension that provides authors a new hook for when the player (or any NPC) fails an action.

holdings.author: Ron Newcomb
holdings.title: Scope Control
holdings.summary: Allows us to ask why the Deciding the Scope For Something activity is running, so we can modify the scope only when we absolutely need to.  Highly useful for giving NPCs commands over telephones or while in darkness, creating 'can hear' relations, or modifying how Inform parses the command line.

holdings.author: Aaron Reed
holdings.title: Numbered Disambiguation Choices
holdings.summary: Numbers the options in disambiguation questions, to help new players and solve the 'disambiguation loop' problem caused by indistinguishable objects.

holdings.author: Juhana Leinonen
holdings.title: Reversed Persuasion Correction
holdings.summary: Automatically corrects commands given to NPCs where the word order is reversed, for example HELLO, ALICE instead of ALICE, HELLO.

holdings.author: Brian Rushton
holdings.title: Clues and Conversation
holdings.summary: A simple system for building conversations.

holdings.author: Eric Eve
holdings.title: Conversation Framework
holdings.summary: A framework for conversations that allows saying hello and goodbye, abbreviated forms of ask and tell commands for conversing with the current interlocutor, and asking and telling about things as well as topics.

holdings.author: Chris Conley
holdings.title: Threaded Conversation
holdings.summary: A conversation system tracking facts known, phrases spoken, and subjects of conversation, modified from the original by Emily Short. Combines ask/tell style commands with hints about what to say next, and extensive authoring tools for organizing and controlling the flow of conversations. Requires Conversation Framework by Eric Eve.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Inanimate Listeners
holdings.summary: Allows the player to address inanimate objects such as a talking computer, microphone, or telephone in a form such as ASK COMPUTER ABOUT COORDINATES.

holdings.author: Eric Eve
holdings.title: Conversation Nodes
holdings.summary: Builds on Conversational Defaults and adds the ability to define particular points in a conversational thread (nodes) at which particular conversational options become available.

holdings.author: Eric Eve
holdings.title: Conversation Package
holdings.summary: This extension includes both Conversation Nodes and Conversation Suggestions, and makes the suggestions aware of conversation nodes. It therefore includes the complete conversational system in one package. It also requires Conversation Responses, Conversational Defaults, Conversation Framework and Epistemology. The documentation for this extension give some guidance on how these other extensions can be mixed and matched.

holdings.author: Eric Eve
holdings.title: Conversation Responses
holdings.summary: Conversation Responses allows response rules for various conversational commands to be written in the form "Response for Bob when asked about..." or "Response for Bob when asked-or-told..." (or many other variations).

holdings.author: Eric Eve
holdings.title: Conversation Suggestions
holdings.summary: Provides a means of suggesting topics of conversation to the player, either in response to a TOPICS command or when NPCs are greeted. This extension requires Conversation Framework.

holdings.author: Eric Eve
holdings.title: Conversational Defaults
holdings.summary: Provides a set of rules to facilitate defining default conversational responses for different conversational commands targeted at various NPCs. This extension requires Conversation Framework.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Mood Variations
holdings.summary: Allows the author to define a mood value for characters and then use text substitutions such as '[when bored]The king fidgets on his throne[or sleepy]The king snores[at other times]The king grins[end when].' Moods will be interpreted in 'writing a paragraph' and similar contexts as the mood of the person described in the paragraph, but at other times according to the mood of the person to whom the player is currently speaking.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Simple Followers
holdings.summary: Allows non-player characters to follow the player (or one another); adds a FOLLOW command and a corresponding STOP FOLLOWING command so that the player can issue these orders to non-player characters. Adds adaptive text features.

holdings.author: Graham Nelson
holdings.title: Rideable Vehicles
holdings.summary: Vehicles which one sits on top of, rather than inside, such as elephants or motorcycles.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Transit System
holdings.summary: Transit System provides a train-car kind which follows a schedule around the map, allowing the player or other characters to get on or off.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Automated Drawers
holdings.summary: Creates a drawer kind of container, which is designed to be part of an item of furniture. Automatically parses names such as 'top drawer' or 'fourth drawer' or 'left drawer'; adds some features for describing furniture with drawers.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Postures
holdings.summary: Postures defines three postures -- seated, standing, and reclining -- and allows pieces of furniture to specify which postures are possible and preferred when the player is on those furnishings.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Modern Conveniences
holdings.summary: Modern Conveniences creates kitchen and bathroom kinds of room, which will automatically be furnished with a set of plausible appliances. (This was originally an example in the manual of how to create extensions, and an annotated version may still be found there.) Version 3 adds compatibility with Measured Liquid, modeling flowing water from taps.

sections.title: Props: Food, Clothing, Money, Toys, Books, Electronics

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Dishes
holdings.summary: Dishes is a convenience extension for use with Measured Liquid. It provides some standard-sized cups, glasses, graduated measuring cups, jugs, bottles, etc., as well as a corked bottle kind that opens with the use of a secondary cork object.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Computers
holdings.summary: Computer hardware and software, including search engines and email programs. Version 3 adds handling for batteries and cords, if we include Power Sources by Emily Short (which itself depends on Plugs and Sockets by Sean Turner).

holdings.author: Bart Massey
holdings.title: Basic Literacy
holdings.summary: Provides objects and actions for (proper) reading, writing and erasing.

sections.title: Physics: Substances, Ropes, Energy and Weight

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Measured Liquid
holdings.summary: Measured Liquid provides a concept of volume, together with the ability to fill containers, pour measured amounts of liquid, and drink from containers. It handles mixtures as well, if desired. It is compatible with, but does not require, the Metric Units extension by Graham Nelson.

holdings.author: Graham Nelson
holdings.title: Metric Units
holdings.summary: Scientific kinds of value for simulations, using real number arithmetic. Uses SI units for mass, elapsed time, electric current, temperature, luminosity, frequency, force, energy, pressure, power, electric charge, voltage, luminance, area, volume, velocity, acceleration, momentum, density, heat capacity.

holdings.author: Graham Nelson
holdings.title: Approximate Metric Units
holdings.summary: Scientific kinds of value for simulations, using scaled integer arithmetic: really only useful for Z-machine projects.

holdings.author: Eric Eve
holdings.title: Bulk Limiter
holdings.summary: Containers that limit their contents by bulk.

holdings.author: Juhana Leinonen
holdings.title: Bulky Items
holdings.summary: Bulky items that can be carried only if the player is not carrying anything else. Version 2 fixes a bug and adds a new example.

holdings.author: Jim Aikin
holdings.title: Notepad
holdings.summary: Provides a new kind of thing called a notepad, which the player (and NPCs) can write in. The text in a notepad can be read, added to, copied, erased, and erased from in a selective manner. It can also be write-protected. A notepad can optionally require a writing implement.

holdings.author: Sean Turner
holdings.title: Plugs and Sockets
holdings.summary: Plug and Sockets is an extension designed to assist with the modelling of devices that can plug and be plugged into. This is done by defining kinds of connectors - male "plugs" and female "sockets" - which form part of the device in question. Grammar is provided to support the connection and disconnection process.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Power Sources
holdings.summary: Power Sources provides an implementation of plugs and batteries, and is designed to be used alongside Computers or as a base for other device implementations. It requires Plugs and Sockets by Sean Turner.

holdings.author: Eric Eve
holdings.title: Alternatives
holdings.summary: Allows checking the presence of an object or value in a set of objects or values with new either/or and neither/nor phrases. e.g., "If the noun is either the carrot or the potato:", or "Instead of eating something when the noun is neither the cake nor the pudding:".

holdings.author: Jesse McGrew
holdings.title: Hypothetical Questions
holdings.summary: Allows us to test the consequences of a phrase or action without permanently changing the game state.

sections.title: Out of World Actions and Effects

holdings.author: Eric Eve
holdings.title: Adaptive Hints
holdings.summary: An adaptive hint system based on Menus by Emily Short.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Basic Help Menu
holdings.summary: Provides a simple collection of standard IF-playing advice that can be incorporated as a help menu in a game.

holdings.author: Wade Clarke
holdings.title: Basic Help Menu
holdings.summary: Adds a HELP command to your Glulx or Z-Code project for Inform 6M62 or later which brings up a menu giving some standard instructions about IF. This is a tech and content update of Emily Short's Basic Help Menu extension made for compatibility with Wade Clarke's Menus. Requires Menus by Wade Clarke (version 5 or greater) to run.

holdings.author: Wade Clarke
holdings.title: Menus
holdings.summary: Lets you include a menu system of help, hints and/or other information in your Glulx or Z-Code project for Inform 6M62 or later. This upgrade of Emily Short's classic Menus extension features user-friendly single keypress controls, a more sophisticated UI, compatibility with screen readers and portable devices, an optional book mode with automatic pagination, and isolated message content to make translations easier. Classic Menus tables can be reformatted for this extension with a little work.

holdings.author: Aaron Reed
holdings.title: Commonly Unimplemented
holdings.summary: Responds to attempts to interact with unimplemented clothing, body parts, or generic surroundings. Requires Smarter Parser by Aaron Reed.

holdings.author: Aaron Reed
holdings.title: Poor Man's Mistype
holdings.summary: Adds basic typo correction by checking the first few letters of misunderstood input against the printed names of visible objects. Requires Smarter Parser by Aaron Reed.

holdings.author: Aaron Reed
holdings.title: Smarter Parser
holdings.summary: Understands a broader range of input than the standard parser, and can direct new players towards proper syntax. A rules-based system makes it easy to customize by removing or add new forms of understood input.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Tutorial Mode
holdings.summary: Adds a tutorial mode, which is on by default, to any game, to introduce key actions for the novice player. Can be revised or expanded by the author.

holdings.author: Juhana Leinonen
holdings.title: Achievements
holdings.summary: A simple but flexible rule-based achievement system. Awarded achievements can optionally persist in external files after a restart.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Recorded Endings
holdings.summary: Records the endings the player encounters in multiple play-throughs to an external file; then adds an ENDINGS option to the final question to allow the player to review which endings he has seen so far.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Basic Screen Effects
holdings.summary: Waiting for a keypress; clearing the screen. Also provides facilities for changing the foreground and background colors of text, when using the z-machine. These abilities will not function under Glulx.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Glulx Text Effects
holdings.summary: Glulx Text Effects provides an easy way to set up special text effects for Glulx.

holdings.author: Graham Nelson
holdings.title: Unicode Character Names
holdings.summary: Defines 2909 names like [unicode Greek small letter gamma] for Latin, Cyrillic, Greek and Hebrew letters, along with currency and other symbols.

holdings.author: Graham Nelson
holdings.title: Unicode Full Character Names
holdings.summary: Defines 12997 names like [unicode Arabic letter hah with three dots above] for the full range of characters named in the Unicode 4.1 standard.

holdings.author: Eric Eve
holdings.title: Exit Lister
holdings.summary: A status line exit-lister and an EXITS command, with optional colouring of unvisited exits.

holdings.author: Stephen Granade
holdings.title: Footnotes
holdings.summary: Lets you add footnotes to your game, similar to those in the Infocom game Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy. Footnotes are numbered beginning with 1, and are only assigned numbers as they are referenced. The player can turn footnoting on and off.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Menus
holdings.summary: A table-based way to display full-screen menus to the player.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Glulx Entry Points
holdings.summary: Provides hooks to allow the author to write specialized multimedia behavior that would normally go through HandleGlkEvent. This is a rather dull utility library that will be of most use to authors wanting to write Glulx extensions compatible with other Glulx extensions already in use.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Glulx Image Centering
holdings.summary: Glulx Image Centering adds the ability to display an image that is centered (left/right) on the screen.

holdings.author: Michael Kielstra
holdings.title: Debug Tags
holdings.summary: Allows you to take quick notes about what needs to be done, where it needs to be done, and who needs to do it.  It’s scriptable, extensible, and interacts better with the rest of Inform than [TODO: ] comments do.  All your tags live next to the code in question, and they can even be in rooms in-game, but they’re accessible from anywhere.  Best of all, if you leave one in by accident, the end-user will never notice as they destroy themselves in release builds.

holdings.author: Juhana Leinonen
holdings.title: Debug Files
holdings.summary: A development tool for saving debugging information to an external text file during beta testing. (Glulx-only)

holdings.author: Juhana Leinonen
holdings.title: Object Response Tests
holdings.summary: A development tool for testing all actions on any given object - or one action on all objects - at once to see whether the game's responses are sensible. Version 2 adds the possibility to test individual actions and to run the tests with NPC as the actor.

holdings.author: Emily Short
holdings.title: Property Checking
holdings.summary: A lightweight extension to identify rooms and objects in a game for which no description has yet been written.
